intro: Sparattanthelium, commonly known as the silverleaf grass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It features narrow, silver-gray blades that are adapted to reduce water loss in hot, dry environments. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. Its root system is deep and fibrous, allowing it to access moisture from lower soil layers. Sparattanthelium is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental foliage.
